result.execSummary:
The defendant David C. Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality-"Repeater"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all earnings received in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  Court authorizes entry of a civil judgment in the event any balance remains outstanding at the expiration of Extended Supervision.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victim as named in the Complaint.

No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.  Court orders DNA Surcharge as required.  Defendant to comply with any other terms or conditions as requested by the Supervising Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: from Judge Slate to Defendant, Dated 12/6/2016
from Defendant with Attachments, Dated 11/16/2016 Re: DOC Surcharge
From David Schroeder to  Court and Court response
Plea & Sentencing held July 8, 2016

Case Called @ 9:00 AM: Defendant David C. Schroeder in court with attorney Katherine Seifert.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Terms of agreement recited by Atty Seifert with argued terms on sentencing today.  State confirms and recites further terms of agreement and basis for Repeater Enhancer.  Def confirms agreement reached.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today.   Elements of offense explained as to State's motion to amend w/Repeater component.  Def agrees and confirms previous conviction that supports Repeater Enhancer.  Def confirms satisfied with representation.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim present.  Plea Misd Battery contrary to s. 940.19(1) as Repeater:  NC  Court accepts plea to amended charge and enters JOC.  Victim NS sworn in for testimony.  Court addresses colloquy with victim as to testimony.  Court advises Def he may testify freely but is not compelled to do so.  Direct Exam by Atty Seifert.  Victim makes statement on his own behalf.  Cross Exam by DA.  Court addresses Victim directly.  Captain Jason Wilke sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Seifert.  No Cross Exam by DA.  Argument by DA prior to SEH.  Argument by Atty Seifert prior to SEH.  Statement by Def prior to SEH.  The Court:   2 yrs term of imprisonment, bifurcated as 18 mos IC/6 mos ES - to be served consecutive to any other SEH currently being served.  Conditions of ES:  Court Costs; NC w/Victim; any other recommendations by parole agent, DNA Sample to be provided.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all earnings received in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If any outstanding balance at the expiration of ES, shall be converted to civil judgment.   SEH to start immediately following current SEH.  Def makes statement as to DNA Sample.  Court explained DNA is dictated by legislature. Law Enforcement confirms sample already on file - Surcharge required however.   Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
from Atty Seifert Re: Confirmation of resolution reached and cancellation of JT scheduled for 7/8/2016.
Motion hearing on July 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
State's Motion to Amend Complaint/Information

Case Called @ 2:10 PM: Attorney Katherine Seifert in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes JT scheduled for 7/8/2016 and has reviewed PT filings by counsel.  Counsel confirm that JT remains on the calendar.  In light of Def not being present, Court will not address any motions today.  State requests that Court address 906.09 motion and attire of Defendant for JT and other penal witnesses.  Atty Seifert states her position for attire on the day of JT.  Court will speak with Court Security as to preference for JT and their comfort level.  Court will defer greatly to Security officer though reserves the right to overrule.  As to Witnesses - State advises the Court as to expected locations during trial and potential recesses once each witness is called.  Per Atty Seifert:  Requests NCIC as to all witnesses.  DA has no objection to providing same.  Court will address all motions on the morning of trial Counsel to be present in Courtroom by 8:15 AM on day of trial.  As to Voir Dire - Court explains general practice.  Court reserves any arguments of counsel outside the presence of the panel - that remains the Court's practice.

Case Called @ 10:45 AM: Defendant David C. Schroeder in court with attorney Leonard D. Kachinsky.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sgt. Tom Dobberstein sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  Ex No 1 marked - 4 Photographs.  Entered and Received.  Record to reflect positive ID of Defendant by Witness.  Cross-Exam by Atty Kachinsky.  The Court:  Finds probable cause demonstrated within this record that a felony offense was committed by this Def - includes offense charge din Ct 1 of Complaint.  Def BOT.  Telephonic ARGN scheduled - Counsel and Def agree to have ARGN conducted via telephone so as not to transport Def for the proceeding.  Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called  @ 1:10 PM: Defendant David C. Schroeder in court, in custody, with attorney Leonard D. Kachinsky, both appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Atty Kachinsky requests scheduling of a pre-lim hearing.  Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  ADA argues for $2500 Signauture Bond with conditions.  Atty Kachinsky has no objection to Signature Bond.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
